overview.title: Overview
overview.firstSentence: Duo integrates with Kazoo to add two-factor authentication to your Kazoo logins.
overview.secondSentence: Two factor strengthens access security by requiring two methods (also referred to as factors) to verify your identity. These factors can include something you know - like a username and password, plus something you have - like a smartphone app to approve authentication requests.
overview.thirdSentence: Two-factor authentication protects against phishing, social engineering and password brute-force attacks and secures your logins from attackers exploiting weak or stolen credentials.

firstSteps.fifthStep: Click 'generate' or enter your own application secrect key

firstSteps.eigthStep: Configure Kazoo authentication to use the Duo integration

configureAuth.title: Configure Kazoo Authentication
configureAuth.firstStep: Enable the API Authentication Monster UI application if it is not already in the Application Exchange
configureAuth.secondStep: Switch to the API Authentication application
configureAuth.thirdStep: Click on the User Authentication tab
configureAuth.fourthStep: Enable 2-factor authentication and select Duo as the provider.
configureAuth.fifthStep: Configure Kazoo authentication to use the Duo integration
configureAuth.sixthStep: Choose if you want to provide 2-factor for sub-accounts as well
